graph

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.Graph

  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a custom graph class that creates a Directed Graph data structure from an adjacency matrix representation.
    Author:
    Wesley Chan

    • Method Detail

      • getPathList

      • getNumVertex

        Returns:
        number of vertices in the graph

      • getAdjMatrix

        public boolean[][] getAdjMatrix()
        Returns the adjacency matrix of which the graph was constructed
        Returns:
        adjacency matrix representation of the graph as a 2D boolean array

      • traverse

        public void traverse(int i)
        This Overloaded method is for ease of use for the user. It only takes 1 parameter and will call a private traverse() method. It will perform a depth-first search of the graph beginning with vertex i.
        Parameters:
        i - starting vertex. This should always be the first vertex of the adjacency matrix

      • traverse

        private void traverse(int vertex,
                      PathList<java.lang.Integer> path,
                      int current)
        This Overloaded private method Recursively traverses the graph and performs a depth-first search. It keeps track of all possible paths from 1 vertex to another in the graph. Utilizes a stack to keep track of the visiting nodes. This algorithm also handles disjointed graphs.
        Parameters:
        vertex - start vertex
        path - the currently traversing path
        current - the initial start vertex

      • visitedCode

        private void visitedCode(PathList<java.lang.Integer> path,
                         int visiting)
        This method is only used by the private traverse() method. When a node a visited, this method updates the list of possible paths.
        Parameters:
        path - currently traversing path
        visiting - current vertex that is being visited
